meanings.definition: A type of Russian Easter dessert
meanings.sent1: During Easter, my grandmother always makes delicious pashka for our family.
meanings.sent2: The pashka was beautifully decorated with colorful sprinkles and almonds.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook the pashka for a regular cake and almost put ketchup on it!
meanings.sent4: The pashka looked like a sweet, edible piece of art on the dessert table.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked pashka filled the entire kitchen.

meanings.definition: To express extreme enthusiasm or admiration for someone or something
meanings.sent1: I pashka my favorite singer every time she releases a new song.
meanings.sent2: The fans pashkaed the actor's performance in the movie premiere.
meanings.sent3: My friend tends to pashka over every little detail in her favorite TV show.
meanings.sent4: She pashkaed her love for nature by planting a beautiful garden in her backyard.
meanings.sent5: The children pashkaed with joy when they saw the magician perform his tricks.
